author: {'steamid': '76561198108295639', 'num_games_owned': 412, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1470794008}
review:
A very stupid and ugly game. But hey, aren't we all a little stupid and ugly?

I remember putting on my own music and beating this whole game in a single sitting in 2016. 

If you have a very casual enjoyment of shoot 'em up games and you got 3 dollars burning a hole in your pocket, go for it.

Really, It's been nearly 8 years and I still think "That game was kind of fun," whenever I scroll past it on Steam.

5.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198082117469', 'num_games_owned': 12527, 'num_reviews': 568, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1603225548}
review:
Sympathique petit Shoot'em up un peu fouilli (beaucoup de chose incompréhensible apparaissent à l'écran, un mode Histoire drôle.
Les Items sont juste indiqué par des lettres mais si on veut jouer sans rien lire on ne comprend pas à quoi ils servent ni ce que c'est.
Musique répétitive sur les niveaux, mais sinon chaque Boss ont leur musique personnelle.
Parfois certains font de niveaux sont perturbant, surtout ceux donc les nuages blanc sont abondant.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015466047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 249, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1464557389}
review: I think there are better games at similarly low prices on Steam.  Infinite Shooter is underwhelming: few sound effects, little music, amateurish artwork, barebones menus.  Plenty of other options that pack more of a punch than this game does.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034062675', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1604336933}
review:
It's not pretty.  It's not flashy.  Theres no story.  It's full of dumb jokes and laughable "Characters".

But after an hour of play; it's got tight controls (Didn't find a way to remap, but honestly, I was too busy playing the game to really look), an easy to navigate UI, easy to understand but difficult to master AI, and the upgrade/ship system adds something I've never really experianced before in the genre.  The soundtrack is pretty sweet, too, and I wish I could get it as a DLC (In Lossless format, please).

In short; it's a diamond in the rough.  Even at full price ($1.99 at the time of this review), it's worth the coin and I got it on sale.  I've paid a lot more for a lot less.  Fans of the genre; get this. It's not perfect, but it IS enjoyable.
